seg-source.mrk: stopSlave

target.mrk: stopSlave

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Stops database replication on the slave system.

seg-source.mrk: Stops database replication on the slave system.

target.mrk: Stops database replication on the slave system.

trans-unit.source: You can specify this connection URL attribute only if the network connection between the master and slave systems is down. If the network connection is working, the slave system accepts commands only from the master, so you must specify the stopMaster=true attribute on the master system to stop replication on both the master and slave systems.

seg-source.mrk: You can specify this connection URL attribute only if the network connection between the master and slave systems is down.

If the network connection is working, the slave system accepts commands only from the master, so you must specify the stopMaster=true attribute on the master system to stop replication on both the master and slave systems.

target.mrk: You can specify this connection URL attribute only if the network connection between the master and slave systems is down.

If the network connection is working, the slave system accepts commands only from the master, so you must specify the stopMaster=true attribute on the master system to stop replication on both the master and slave systems.

trans-unit.source: When this attribute is specified, or when a stop-slave message is sent as part of the execution of the stopMaster=true attribute, all transaction log chunks that have been received from the master are written to disk. Both the slave replication functionality and the database are then shut down.

seg-source.mrk: When this attribute is specified, or when a stop-slave message is sent as part of the execution of the stopMaster=true attribute, all transaction log chunks that have been received from the master are written to disk.
Both the slave replication functionality and the database are then shut down.

target.mrk: When this attribute is specified, or when a stop-slave message is sent as part of the execution of the stopMaster=true attribute, all transaction log chunks that have been received from the master are written to disk.
Both the slave replication functionality and the database are then shut down.

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> instance where this attribute is specified must be serving the specified database in replication slave mode.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> instance where this attribute is specified must be serving the specified database in replication slave mode.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> instance where this attribute is specified must be serving the specified database in replication slave mode.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the topics under "Replicating databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information, see the topics under "Replicating databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information, see the topics under "Replicating databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: Combining with other attributes

target.mrk: Combining with other attributes

trans-unit.source: You must specify a database name in the connection URL, either in the subprotocol or by using the databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute.

seg-source.mrk: You must specify a database name in the connection URL, either in the subprotocol or by using the databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute.

target.mrk: You must specify a database name in the connection URL, either in the subprotocol or by using the databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute.

trans-unit.source: If authentication is turned on, you must also specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes. Authorization for the master database cannot be checked when the network connection is down, so the requirement that the user must be the database owner is not enforced.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication is turned on, you must also specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.
Authorization for the master database cannot be checked when the network connection is down, so the requirement that the user must be the database owner is not enforced.

target.mrk: If authentication is turned on, you must also specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.
Authorization for the master database cannot be checked when the network connection is down, so the requirement that the user must be the database owner is not enforced.

trans-unit.source: You may not specify this attribute in conjunction with any attributes not mentioned in this section.

seg-source.mrk: You may not specify this attribute in conjunction with any attributes not mentioned in this section.

target.mrk: You may not specify this attribute in conjunction with any attributes not mentioned in this section.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: -- stop slave from master using database name in subprotocol, -- authorization jdbc:derby:myDB;stopSlave=true;user=mary;password=little88lamb

seg-source.mrk: -- stop slave from master using database name in subprotocol, -- authorization jdbc:derby:myDB;stopSlave=true;user=mary;password=little88lamb

target.mrk: -- stop slave from master using database name in subprotocol, -- authorization jdbc:derby:myDB;stopSlave=true;user=mary;password=little88lamb

trans-unit.source: -- stop slave using databaseName attribute, no security jdbc:derby:;databaseName=myDB;stopSlave=true;

seg-source.mrk: -- stop slave using databaseName attribute, no security jdbc:derby:;databaseName=myDB;stopSlave=true;

target.mrk: -- stop slave using databaseName attribute, no security jdbc:derby:;databaseName=myDB;stopSlave=true;
